text: Alliance = Star Empire + Trade Federation Coalition = Trade Federation + Machine Cult Unity = Machine Cult + Blob Union = Blob + Star Empire The multicolor symbols above each count as two existing Star Realms factions. For example, if you have an Alliance card in play, you may activate any Star Empire or Trade Federation ally abilities. Alternatively, if you have a Star Empire or Trade Federation card in play, you may activate any Alliance ally abilities.
name: rulesUnitedCommand

label: Thank You Backers|Kickstarter Promo Pack
text: Thank you backers for an incredible Kickstarter campaign! As a thank you for your patience and support, we have added a few extra promo cards (2 Powerful Backing and 1 Patience Rewarded)! Thank you again, and I hope you have as much fun playing these Star Realms sets as we had making them! Rob Dougherty - CEO, White Wizard Games | Docking If a ship returns to your hand with docking, it does so AFTER you draw your hand, so you will end your turn with an extra card in hand. Midgate Station If you discard 0 cards with its primary ability, you choose to gain 1 Trade or Combat. Scrap this card ally abilities Like any ally abilities, these trigger when you have another card of their faction in play, but you choose if and when to use this ability once it has been triggered. So, if you dont want to scrap the card, just dont use the ally ability. Powerful Backing The player currently taking their turn counts as having two extra cards of each faction in play that turn for triggering their ally and double ally abilities. Patience Rewarded Like with all cards where each player makes a choice, start with the player currently taking their turn and proceed clockwise.
name: thankYouBackersKickstarterPromoPack

label: Le's Foray | Rules (Part 1 of 3)
text: Scrap: Until end of turn, you may use all of your Star Empire ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Machine Cult ally abilities. You may scrap a card in your hand or discard pile. If you do, draw a card. | When playing with the Allignment Command Deck, you are Divine Admiral Le, legendary commander of the Alignment. While you will be able to acquire and play cards of any faction, your starting deck and gambits work particularly well with Star Empire and Machine Cult cards. This Command Deck may be played one-on-one against any other Command Deck, or, you can use it to take on two players playing standard starting decks! <u>2 vs 1</u> When playing against two players, those players use standard starting decks (eight Scout and two Viper cards). They play as a Hydra team with a total of 75 Authority . Hydra teams share a turn, may share trade and combat, but have separate decks and ally triggers (see Star Realms Rulebook, Formats section). <u>Setup</u> At the start of the game, place your Divine Admiral Le card, along with your Alignment Ingenuity and Les Foray gambit cards, face up in front of you. Note: Your Divine Admiral Le card is for reference, and does not count as a Star Empire or Machine Cult card in play for triggering Ally Abilities.
name: leSForayRulesPart1Of3

label: Alignment Ingenuity | Rules (Part 2 of 3)
text: Whenever you use a Scrap ability of a ship or base, you may draw a card, then discard a card. | <u>Setup (Cont.)</u> You have a hand size of six cards and start with 64 Authority. You may track your Authority with the included scorecards. - Rotate and/or flip this card to represent a change in the tens digit. - Slide and/or flip this card to represent a change in the ones digit. Add the two numbers in the circle to get your Authority score. This shows a score of 68. Shuffle the Mech Battleship card into the Trade Deck before laying out the starting Trade Row. This would be a great card for you to buy, but watch out, your opponents are allowed to acquire it as well! Shuffle the other 12 cards (Imperial Talon, Imperial Viper, Ranger, Salvage Drone, [4] Scout, Scout Bot, Stellar Falcon, Viper, and Welder Drone) to create your Personal Deck. When playing first you get a three card starting hand, and when going second you get a six card starting hand.
name: alignmentIngenuityRulesPart2Of3

label: Divine Admiral Le | Rules (Part 3 of 3)
text: You have a hand size of six cards and start with 64 Authority. | <u>Alignment Faction Symbol</u> This faction symbol represents both Star Empire and Machine Cult . Mech Battleship counts as a card of both factions, and will trigger the Ally Abilities of either. Its own Ally Ability can be triggered by either a Star Empire or Machine Cult card. <u>Alignment Ingenuity</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you all game. When you use the Scrap ability of a ship or base, first resolve the abilitys effect. Afterwards, you may draw a card, then discard a card. <u>Les Foray</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you until you use it. You may do this by scrapping it at any time during your Main Phase. When you use it, you count as having an additional Star Empire and Machine Cult card in play that turn for triggering Ally Abilities. Learn more about playing with Command Decks at: <u>StarRealms.com/CommandDecks</u>
name: divineAdmiralLeRulesPart3Of3

label: Nandis Onslaught | Rules (Part 1 of 3)
text: Scrap: Until end of turn, you may use all of your Star Empire ally abilities. Until end of turn, you may use all of your Trade Federation ally abilities. Draw two cards, then you and each opponent discard a card. | When playing with the Alliance Command Deck, you are Fleet Director Nandi, legendary commander of the Alliance. While you will be able to acquire and play cards of any faction, your starting deck and gambits work particularly well with Star Empire and Trade Federation cards. This Command Deck may be played one-on-one against any other Command Deck, or, you can use it to take on two players playing standard starting decks! <u>2 vs 1</u> When playing against two players, those players use standard starting decks (eight Scout and two Viper cards). They play as a Hydra team with a total of 75 Authority. Hydra teams share a turn, may share trade and combat, but have separate decks and ally triggers (see Star Realms Rulebook, Formats section). <u>Setup</u> At the start of the game, place your Fleet Director Nandi card, along with your Alliance Procurement and Nandis Onslaught gambit cards, face up in front of you. Note: Your Fleet Director Nandi card is for reference, and does not count as a Star Empire or Trade Federation card in play for triggering Ally Abilities.
name: nandiSOnslaughtRulesPart1Of3

label: Alliance Procurement | Rules (Part 2 of 3)
text: Once each turn, you may gain 2 Trade or put the next ship or base you acquire on top of your deck. | <u>Setup (Cont.)</u> You have a hand size of five cards and start with 68 Authority. You may track your Authority with the included scorecards. - Rotate and/or flip this card to represent a change in the tens digit. - Slide and/or flip this card to represent a change in the ones digit. Add the two numbers in the circle to get your Authority score. This shows a score of 68. Shuffle the Super Freighter card into the Trade Deck before laying out the starting Trade Row. This would be a great card for you to buy, but watch out, your opponents are allowed to acquire it as well! Shuffle the other 12 cards (Cargo Boat, Diplomatic Shuttle, Federation Scout, Imperial Viper, Ranger, [4] Scout, Stellar Falcon, Tribute Transport and Viper) to create your Personal Deck. When playing first you get a three card starting hand, and when going second you get a five card starting hand.
name: allianceProcurementRulesPart2Of3

label: Fleet Director Nandi | Rules (Part 3 of 3)
text: You have a hand size of five cards and start with 68 Authority. | <u>Alliance Faction Symbol</u> This faction symbol represents both Star Empire and Trade Federation . Super Freighter counts as a card of both factions, and will trigger the Ally Abilities of either. Its own Ally Ability can be triggered by either a Star Empire or Trade Federation card. <u>Alliance Procurement</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you all game. It may be used once on each of your turns, at any time during your Main Phase. When you use it, decide whether to gain 2 Trade or put the next ship or base you acquire on top of your deck. <u>Nandis Onslaught</u> This gambit remains face up in front of you until you use it. You may do this by scrapping it at any time during your Main Phase. When you use it, you count as having an additional Star Empire and Trade Federation card in play that turn for triggering Ally Abilities. Learn more about playing with Command Decks at: <u>StarRealms.com/CommandDecks</u>
name: fleetDirectorNandiRulesPart3Of3
